SEARCH
Package danogl.gui.rendering

Interface Renderable

All Known Implementing Classes:
AnimationRenderable, ImageRenderable, OvalRenderable, RectangleRenderable, SwitchRenderable, TextRenderable
Functional Interface:
This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.
@FunctionalInterface public interface Renderable
Represents a visual representation of a game object
Author:
Dan Nirel

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    default void
    render(Graphics2D g, Vector2 topLeftCorner, Vector2 dimensions)
    Renders the object.
    void
    render(Graphics2D g, Vector2 topLeftCorner, Vector2 dimensions, double degreesCounterClockwise, boolean isFlippedHorizontally, boolean isFlippedVertically, double opaqueness)
    Renders the object.
    default void
    update(double deltaTime)
    This should be called every frame if the Renderable is dynamic.

  • Method Details

    • update

      default void update(double deltaTime)
      This should be called every frame if the Renderable is dynamic. Implementing this method is optional.
      Parameters:
      deltaTime - Time since last frame

    • render

      default void render(Graphics2D g, Vector2 topLeftCorner, Vector2 dimensions)
      Renders the object.
      Parameters:
      g - The graphics object.
      topLeftCorner - Top-left corner of where to render the renderable.
      dimensions - Dimensions of the renderable (in pixels).

    • render

      void render(Graphics2D g, Vector2 topLeftCorner, Vector2 dimensions, double degreesCounterClockwise, boolean isFlippedHorizontally, boolean isFlippedVertically, double opaqueness)
      Renders the object. Should be called at the render phase.
      Parameters:
      g - The graphics object.
      topLeftCorner - Top-left corner of where to render the renderable.
      dimensions - Dimensions of the renderable (in pixels).
      degreesCounterClockwise - Angle of the image. The image is rotated around its center.
      isFlippedHorizontally - True to mirror the renderable (left-right).
      isFlippedVertically - True to mirror the renderable (up-down).
      opaqueness - 1 for opaque, 0 for invisible, values in between for degrees of transparency.
